item.title: Paradigms - July 19, 2009
item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

Marc Sapir MD is interviewed, and the Charlie Messing Duo (Charlie Messing and Ben Littenberg) join us in the studio. Additional music by The Staple Singers, Howlin' Wolf, Tom Waits and Bob Dylan. item.title: Paradigms - July 26, 2009
item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

Film maker Donna Read is interviewed, and bassist Ellen Powell joins us in the studio. Ellen brought recordings of herself playing with guitarist Gerry Lavene, vocalist/songwriter Mary McGinnis, Andy Sacher on mandolin, Roy Feldman on violin, Chris Peterman tenor sax, Steve Wienert on drums, Michael Sucher on piano. Additional music by Abbey Lincoln and Joao Bosco.

Additional music from Abbey Lincoln and Joao Bosco.

item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

This episode focuses on the turning of the wheel, Samhain, the Witches New Year, which is known to most as Halowe'en. Tonight's interviews are with Tara McFarland and M. Macha NightMare, with a beautiful ancestor invocation from Macha. Music by: Velvet Hammer, Sarah McLachlan, Yoko Ono, Rodney Crowell, Jethro Tull, Jerry Garcia, Ralph Stanley, Gaia Consort, Moonrise, Patti Smith Group, Jeff Buckley, Native Flute Ensemble, Fleetwood Mac, and Will Millar.

Dr. Annette Goodheart joins us to discuss the healing properties of laughter and other forms of catharsis. In light of the mining disaster in West Virginia this week we will listen to some songs from and about coal miners and their families. Music by: Cosy Sheridan, Sarah Gunning, The Woods Tea Co., Sammy Walker, and Green Bailey. Baruch's Blog http://baruchzedblog.blogspot.com

item.title: Paradigms - October 31, 2010
item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

This Halloween we hear from three voices, Anita Resink of Amsterdam, Holland, Deborah Oak Cooper from San Francisco, California and Angela Magara from Plainfield, Vermont. The topics include ancestor work and geomancy, the Mexican celebration of Dia De Los Muertos, and the way that death is part of life. Angela reads from her book "Earth Psalms." We honor musician Kenny Edwards who died in August. Music by: Yorgi, Bone Poet's Orchestra, Tom Rush, Aaron Flinn's Salad Days, The Bearles, Bill Fadden & The Mostly Losers, Laura Nyro, Tulku, Nina Simone, Willy Porter, Ieia Dement, Stone Poneys, Bryndle, and Kenny Edwards.

item.title: Paradigms - February 27, 2011
item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

Interviews from Vermont, Massachusetts, Maryland and Wisconsin. Protests against union busting and corporatocracy are occurring around the United States. People are recognizing that the economic, social and political landscapes of the US are being reshaped in accordance with a corporate agenda that impoverishes the working people and turns economic and political control of the country over to corporations. Music by: Cat Stevens, Bob Marley and The Wailers, Maria Muldaur, Ani Difranco and Utah Phillips, Mirian Makeba, New York Rock & Soul Review, Kirsty Maccoll, Michael Franti & Spearhead, Billy Bragg, Dana Lyons, Phoebe Snow, Los Lobos, The Byrds, Edwin Starr, and Blackfire.

item.title: Paradigms - March 6, 2011
item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

Senator Bernie Sanders hosted a Town Meeting in Montpelier, Vermont on Saturday Match 5. The focus was on the issue of corporate personhood, the effects of the Citizen's United decision, the proposed bill J.R.S.11 in the Vermont Senate and the national movement to amend the US Constitution to eliminate corporate personhood. Guests: radio host and author Thom Hartmann, Rob Weissman national president of Public Citizen, Cheryl Hanna a constitutional law professor at Vermont Law School, and Vermont state Senator Ginny Lyons. Also present were Ben Cohen and Jerry Greenfield of Ben & Jerry's Homemade Ice Cream. Over 500 people attended the Town Meeting. Music by: Cabaret Broadway cast, Dire Straits, Alan Price, Steve Earle, Aretha Franklin, Buffy Sainte-Marie, John Gorka, Annie Lennox, and the Decentz.

item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

The Lowell Mtn. wind project in Vermont, pro and con, with 6 interviews including Annette Smith, Luke Snelling, Dorothy Schnure, and others. This is a great opportunity to learn more about wind energy, centralized vs. decentralized models of energy generation, and what you can do to participate in the democratization of electricity. Note: Some of the interviews were too long to air in their entirety. Complete interviews are available at the Paradigms website http://paradigms.bz. Music by: The Blood Oranges, Roxy Music, Badmarsh and Shri, Steeleye Span, Derrik Jordan, Kasey Chambers, Banjo Dan & The Midnight Plowboys, Dave Carter & Tracy Grammer, Dana Lyons, David Lindley, Evergreen Erb, and The Beatles.

Ben & Jerry's invited two organizers from Occupy Wall Street to come to Vermont to speak in a public forum with Ben & Jerry's executives on February 9, 2012. Participants in Occupy Vermont-Burlington were also present. This is a great opportunity to deepen one's understanding of the Occupy movement. item.title: Paradigms - March 25, 2012
item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

The Sage Alliance protested the continued operation of Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Plant by marching from the Brattleboro Town Commons to the Entergy Corporation offices on Wednesday, March 22, 2012. This episode of Paradigms brings you most of the pre-march rally and some of the post-march rally as over 130 people prepared to engage in civil disobedience and face arrest. Great music, good fun, and an inspiring message of democracy! This is how we do it in Vermont! Music by: Scott Ainslee, Charlie King and Karen Brandow,The Shut'Er Down Brass Band, The Raging Grannies, and Gil Scott-Heron.

item.title: Paradigms - April 1, 2012
item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

Jim Lantz is a filmmaker and playwright whose play "The Bus" debuted in Burlington, VT and made it to Off-Broadway in NYC. Jim is now working on a film, A Defiant Dude, with Bo Muller-Moore, the Eat More Kale guy. Ryan Harb returns to Paradigms a year after his initial visit to tell us about what's happened with the UMASS Amherst Permaculture Project; some very exciting stuff! Music by: Bruce Cockburn, Coldplay, Elton John & Leon Russell, Micah Atwell, Cassandra Wilson, Terry Reid, Nils Lofgren, Blondie, Jerry Garcia, and Bonnie Raitt.

item.title: Paradigms - April 15, 2012
item.description:
Paradigms is a radio show which explores the question "What visions do you have of a viable future for life on Earth, including humans?" Paradigms combines interviews with inspired/inspiring people and music.

The Vermont Legislature is considering passing a law requiring all GMO foods to be labeled as such. The Bio-tech industry is threatening to sue Vermont if they pass this law. On April 12, 2012, prior to the final Ag Committee hearing on the bill, there was a rally in front of the Vermont State House. This episode brings you Dave Rogers of NOFA VT to explain the bill and it's status, as well as interviews and speakers from the rally. Music by: Derrik Jordan, Eva Cassidy, Maria Muldaur, Dana Lyons, Marvin Gaye, Jimmy Cliff, Mark Knopfler, Bonnie Raitt, Fleetwood Mac, Pure Prairie League, Alan Price, J.J. Cale, Abra Moore, and Ras Gabriel.
